member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.JapanesePhoneme
member.summary: Represents a single Japanese word (a "reading") that has been extracted from a Japanese string by JapanesePhoneticAnalyzer.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.JapanesePhoneme.DisplayText
member.summary: Gets the text to display for this Japanese word.
member.returns: The display text of this Japanese word. It is a sub-string of the Japanese string originally analyzed by JapanesePhoneticAnalyzer.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.JapanesePhoneme.IsPhraseStart
member.summary: Gets a Boolean that indicates if this Japanese word is the start of a phrase.
member.returns: **true** if this Japanese word is the start of a phrase, otherwise **false**.

member.name: P:Windows.Globalization.JapanesePhoneme.YomiText
member.summary: Gets the "reading" (the pronunciation of DisplayText ) for this Japanese word.
member.returns: The "reading" (the pronunciation of DisplayText, represented by a sequence of Hiragana characters).

member.name: T:Windows.Globalization.JapanesePhoneticAnalyzer
member.summary: Reads a Japanese string that is a combination of Kanji characters and Hiragana characters, and returns a collection of proper readings from the string with word breaks.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.JapanesePhoneticAnalyzer.GetWords(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a Japanese string that is a combination of Kanji characters and Hiragana characters, and returns a collection of proper readings from the string with word breaks.
member.param: A Japanese string that is a combination of Kanji characters and Hiragana characters.
member.returns: A collection of JapanesePhoneme objects that represent proper readings from the string with word breaks.

member.name: M:Windows.Globalization.JapanesePhoneticAnalyzer.GetWords(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads a Japanese string that is a combination of Kanji characters and Hiragana characters, and returns a collection of proper readings from the string with word breaks. Optionally uses the "Mono Ruby" strategy in breaking multi-Kanji words into multiple Kanji words.
member.param: A Japanese string that is a combination of Kanji characters and Hiragana characters.

Specifies the use of the word-breaking strategy "Mono Ruby". If **true**, the word-breaking strategy "Mono Ruby" is used. "Mono Ruby" more aggressively attempts to break multi-Kanji words into multiple Kanji words.
member.returns: A collection of JapanesePhoneme objects that represent proper readings from the string with word breaks.
